title: How to Make Martinis

methods.name: Whipping Up a Classic Gin Martini

steps.headline: Add the ice, gin, and vermouth to a cocktail shaker and stir well.
steps.description: To make the martini, you’ll need a cocktail shaker or mixing glass. Fill it with cracked ice, 2 ½ ounces (74 ml) of  gin and ½ ounce (15 ml) of dry vermouth. Use a long spoon to stir the ingredients for about 15 seconds or until it’s well mixed. If you prefer, you can shake the martini to mix it together.

steps.headline: Strain the martini into a glass.
steps.description: Once you’re done stirring the martini, cover the top of the shaker or glass with a cocktail strainer. Pour the martini into a martini glass through the strainer to remove the ice.

steps.headline: Garnish the martini with an olive and serve.
steps.description: After you’ve poured the martini into the glass, place a single green olive on a toothpick and set it the glass to garnish. Serve the martini while it’s still cold.

steps.headline: Add the ice, vodka, and vermouth to a mixing glass and stir well.
steps.description: Fill a large mixing glass with ice. Next, pour 1 ⅔ parts of vodka and ⅓ part of dry vermouth into the glass. Use a long spoon to stir the ingredients together for 10 to 15 seconds. You can shake the martini if you prefer.

steps.headline: Strain the martini into a chilled glass.
steps.description: Once the martini is mixed, cover the glass with a cocktail strainer. Pour the liquid through the strainer into a chilled glass so you keep the ice out of the glass. To chill the glass, place it in the freezer for 2 minutes before you pour the martini.

steps.headline: Garnish the martini with an olive and lemon twist.
steps.description: After you’ve poured the martini, drop a green olive into the glass. Next, float a piece of lemon rind on top and serve the martini while it’s still chilled.

steps.headline: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
steps.description: To make the martini, you’ll need a cocktail shaker or mason jar. Add enough ice to the shaker to fill it completely.

steps.headline: Add the gin, brine, and vermouth and shake well.
steps.description: Once the shaker is filled with ice, pour 2 ½ shots of gin, ½ shot of cocktail olive brine, and ⅛ shot of extra-dry vermouth over it. Cover the shaker, and shake the contents for 10 to 15 seconds to mix them well.

steps.headline: Strain the martini into a glass and serve.
steps.description: After the martini is mixed, place a cocktail strainer over the top of the shaker and pour the martini through it into a martini  glass. Add a green olive as a garnish and serve the martini while it’s still chilled.
